intro: Faurea intermedia var. katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga faurea, is a shrub native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white inflorescences. The plant typically grows in humid, forested areas and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Its botanical features include compound leaves with serrated margins and small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
